content: If the profile works in safe/troubleshoot mode, launch in troubleshoot mode, 'Reset toolbars & controls', 'Make changes & restart'. If it still doesn't work, report here to change the hardware acceleration setting.

content: I think the reason you don't see that option is that it's always been standard practice to open messages from the Threads Pane (message list), with either double-click, Enter, right-click menu, or middle-click (open in background). On my setup, if I wanted to maximize the Subject column, I would hide all columns except Subject, Date & From (or set Cards View), set Wide View in Layout, and hide or shrink the Message Pane to a small size.
creator: sfhowes

content:
It's possible to hide the entire Header Pane with userChrome.css, or do you want to retain the buttons?

The Header Pane can be resized with the Compact Headers add-on.

content:
The use of mouse and keyboard creates a special event. If this was wrong in the program then it would effect everyone and the outcry would be huge. Such as when the middle click was not opening selected email in a tab in the background. This effected everyone because the code did not exist and a bug report was created and they are working on this.

However, any pressing/clicking of mouse means a signal is sent to the computer and the computer performs the specific event as per program code. If computer is not receiving signals correctly then it is not the program. The likely problem is with the keyboard unless you have been doing something by creating your own keyboard shortcuts.

I've done some tests some only using keyboard and others using a mix of keyboard and mouse.

To select various random emails in list to hightlight: Test 1: Press 'Ctrl' on keyboard and use left click with mouse to select various emails Result: works perfectly ok in both Table View and Cards View.

Test 2: Press/ Hold 'Ctrl', use up/down arrow keys to navigate to email, press 'Space' bar to select/highlight. Result: works perfectly ok in both Table View and Cards View.

To select contigous emails in a block: Test 3: Select an email and press and hold 'Shift', use mouse to select an email several further down list and all in between get highlighted. Result: works perfectly ok in both Table View and Cards View.

Test4: Select email, hold down 'Shift' and use up/down arrow keys on keyboard to select and highlight emails Result: works perfectly ok in both Table View and Cards View.


So, with a fully working keyboard, all the above are working correctly for me. I'm using beta 118.0b6, so this is version 115* - just a few updates ahead of the release version.

I would advise you to start by checking your keyboard because your computer sounds like it is not getting the necessary signals so cannot perform the task in the code.

Possible things to check: Is the 'Scroll Lock' switched on ? Maybe the keyboard is in need of a clean. Maybe you are using 'Razer Cortex' and it's stolen the shortcuts. I did locate this which effected alot of people, not necessarilly using Thunderbird, but a keyboard issue would not necessarilly be Thunderbird specific. https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/excel/ctrl-shift-arrow-up-down-not-working/m-p/1857249
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You have SSL/TLS security on port 587, when it should be STARTTLS on 587, or SSL/TLS on 465.

https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/email-client-programs-with-xfinity-email

content:
Pop account: Can you propvide information on how this account is set up. It just seems a bit odd that email is using Drafts in Local Folders account.

Is this set up as a proper POP account which uses it's own set of folders OR Is this account set up as a deferred account which uses Global Inbox (Local Folders) meaning the pop account does not use it's own folders, it is using 'Local folders' mail account folders ?

What is selected here?

  • 'Account Settings' > 'Server Settings' for pop account
  • Click on 'Advanced' button
  • Is this selected : 'Inbox for this account'
  • OR is this selected : 'Inbox for different account - Global Inbox (Local Folders)  ?
  • In Account Settings window
  • In left pane - scroll to the bottom and click on 'Outgoing Server (SMTP)'

Do not use the accounts 'outgoing server SMTP - Edit SMTP_Server' button' - please do it via method I stated.

It will list all smtp outgoing servers on the right. Is there only one smtp server listed ? I'm assuming your wife only has one pop mail account, so there should only be one outgoing server smtp in list - but is that correct ? Select the correct smtp in list It should say the following, so if anything is different then click on 'Edit'

  • DEscription : email address of account - same as user name below.
  • Server name: smtp.comcast.net
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security : STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name : full email address.

Then check the account really is using the correct smtp:

  • Account Settings > select account name in left pane
  • Look bottom right for Outgoing server (SMTP)
  • It should display what you put in the 'DEscription' field - aka the full email address of account
  • if it does not or you need to double check - click on the drop down icon and select correct smtp server from list.

DO NOT click on the 'Edit SMTP_Server' button You must be certain the correct one has already been selected.


Comcast is xfinity - I presume you know about the need to enable/allow Third party apps, but this is a link to info just in case anyone reading this does not know: https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/third-party-email-access

Passwords stored in Thunderbird Are both incoming and outgoing passwords stored and are both passwords correct?

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'
  • You should have two lines for the mail account:
  • mailbox://pop account name....
  • smtp://pop account name...
  • Both should be using identical passwords - same password you use to logon to the webmail account.
  • Right click on each line in turn and selet 'Edit Password'
  • Completely clear the contents and retype the correct password.
  • Click on 'Close'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: I don't speak from the mountain top; I'm just a lowly volunteer. But if you look at the website at https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/ I think it's pretty clear that 115 is the new direction. Although some people struggle with the new layout, the majority like it and I encourage you to be patient in learning it. I feel confident that reverting to 102 is not in our future. 115 gets better with each update.
